holidays.name: Make Your Bed Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to starting your day productive and positive by making your bed first thing in the morning.
holidays.origin: Popularized by Admiral William H. McRaven's 2014 commencement speech emphasizing the importance of small tasks for success.
holidays.funFact: Admiral McRaven said that making your bed every morning gives you a small sense of pride and encourages you to do another task, and another, and another.

holidays.name: Hug Your Hound Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and show extra love to your dog by giving them an affectionate hug.
holidays.origin: Unofficial pet holiday created by dog lovers to promote bonding and positive attention for dogs.
holidays.funFact: Despite the day’s name, not all dogs like hugs – so it’s a great day to learn your dog's unique way of showing love!

holidays.name: National Hot Cross Bun Day
holidays.description: A tasty day to enjoy the classic spiced hot cross buns traditionally eaten around Easter season, but celebrated again right now!
holidays.origin: Originated in the UK as a religious food symbolizing the end of Lent; this quirky day pops up on September 11 to indulge in this sweet treat again.
holidays.funFact: Hot cross buns were once believed to have magical properties and were hung in kitchens to ward off evil spirits!

holidays.name: Skyscraper Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the towering marvels of architecture that define city skylines around the world.
holidays.origin: Created by architecture enthusiasts to honor the innovation and engineering of tall buildings.
holidays.funFact: The tallest skyscraper in the world as of now is the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, standing at over 828 meters (2,717 feet) tall.
